name: cautiousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
behaviour that avoids risk and is well considered, and sometimes slow or uncertain: Her cautiousness sometimes makes her slow to reach decisions. We have seen more cautiousness in spending. You see cautiousness about making a job change when economic times are uncertain. See
cautious
More examplesFewer examplesAfter years of cautiousness in dealing with the media, he now seems happy to speak openly.the cautiousness of their approachYou could sense a mood of cautiousness and concern.I think we always try to err on the side of cautiousness.
